meanings.definition: To enclose or cover with a case or covering.
meanings.sent1: I will incase the fragile item in bubble wrap before shipping it.
meanings.sent2: Please incase the phone in a protective case to prevent damage.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally incased my keys in a block of ice, and now I can't find them!
meanings.sent4: The darkness incased the forest like a thick blanket, hiding all signs of light.
meanings.sent5: The spider silk incased the prey in a sticky trap, ready to be devoured.

meanings.sent1: Bring an umbrella incase it rains during the picnic.
meanings.sent2: I will pack extra snacks incase we get hungry on the road trip.
meanings.sent3: I wore my sunglasses incase the sun decided to make a surprise appearance.
meanings.sent4: She always carries a flashlight incase of a power outage.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to charge your phone incase you need to make an important call.
